DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood And Additive Total Quantity Volume Or Weight Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place value measured, assigned or computed related to the total quantity of cord blood unit and additives.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood And Additive Total Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition_How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number. [Manually curated].

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A substance that is added to a system or compound to improve its characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
